detail_info.name_class: Duramycin C (natural AMPs; Lantibiotic, type B, class 1 bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXT; UCSS1b; XXK)
detail_info.additional_info: Discovery: isolated from the supernatant of bacterial culture via HPLC purification.Chemical modification: Methyllanthionine rings between residues 1 and18 as well as between residues 5 and 11; a lanthionine occurs between Cys14 and residue 4. In addition, addition of Lys19 to dehydralanine at position 6 forms a lysinoalanine bridge. The Asp residue at position 15 is hydroxylated.Activity: weakly active against B. subtitlis (inhibition zone).MOA:bacteria: Duramycins and cinnamycin specifically binds to phosphatidylethanolamine (Machaidze and Seelig, 2003), thereby indirectly inhibiting the activity of phospholipase A2.Structure: Structure was studied by NMR (Zimmermann et al., 1993).Updated 12/2024
